incidents.name: Cody Gateway unexpected status code 500 error

incident_updates.body: After the taking remedial action Cody Gateway is responding as expected. All services are fully operational.
We have identified and fixed an issue that affects Cody Gateway with error "unexpected status code 500". We are monitoring.

components.name: Cody Gateway
components.description: Gateway service for Sourcegraph instances to access LLMs and embedding providers: https://docs.sourcegraph.com/cody/explanations/cody_gateway

incidents.name: GPT4o and Mistral 8x7b not working for chat

incident_updates.body: We think the impact from the issue is over.
GPT-4o and Mixtral 8x7B are working again. We will be monitoring before we mark this resolved.

Problem: Asking Cody a question using GPT4o or Mistral 8x7b models fails due to a regression caused by a recent update.

Impact: This failure results in errors within VS Code and Cody Web platforms.

Fix: An update is currently being rolled out.

When Asking Cody a question using GPT4o or Mistral 8x7b models fails with the following errors:

VS Code: "SourcegraphNodeCompletionsClient: isError(parseEvents(bufferText)) Error: invalid completion event"

Cody Web: "Request Failed: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'length')"

Please use another model for the meantime.

731k repositories have been indexed for search.

incident_updates.body: Sourcegraph.com has successfully completed maintenance. Search and repository operations are restored.
Sourcegraph.com is undergoing scheduled maintainence - availability of repositories for search may be affected during this time.

At 4:45PM UTC, Sourcegraph.com went offline due to a configuration issue. The issue was identified and fixed around 5:10PM UTC, with most Sourcegraph.com functionality restored by 5:25PM UTC.

This may have caused brief issues with extensions on on-premises Sourcegraph instances.

incidents.name: All Python packages unavailable on Sourcegraph.com

incident_updates.body: At 2am PT all Python packages became unavailable on Sourcegraph.com. This issue was resolved at 7:35am PT and all Python packages are now available again.
This is to confirm that this outage has been resolved and all impacted Sourcegraph services are now up and running for all regions. We appreciate your patience and understanding.

It has come to our attention that some of our Sourcegraph.com and managed instance customers may be experiencing connectivity issues due an ongoing outage with our networking partner. We are beginning to see signs of of recovery however and will share further updates on the situation as they emerge. We apologize for any inconveniences experienced.
This issue has now been resolved. A patch has been released which should address this issue for on-prem customers and fixes have also been deployed to sourcegraph.com.
Our Engineering team is currently working on a fix to address this issue. We will communicate further updates as soon it is applied. Thanks for your patience.

We have identified an issue that can cause you not to get search results that you would expect or see repositories that have been added to Sourcegraph. You are impacted if you are a Sourcegraph.com user using GitLab.com or an on-prem customer using GitLab version 15.0 or later, or older Gitlab versions that have OAuth access token expiration enabled. Otherwise you are not impacted.

If you are impacted, you can remediate this by removing and re-adding GitLab personal code host connection every two hours (if you are a Sourcegraph.com user) or signing out and in every two hours with GitLab OAuth (if you are an on-prem user).

We are currently working to resolve this issue and regret the inconvenience. We will provide an update when functionality is restored.

incidents.name: Unable to add repositories to Cloud

incident_updates.body: This is now fully resolved! Again, we are sorry for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience. If you have any questions, email support@sourcegraph.com.

We have fixed the issue and the situation is stabilizing. Repositories will sync, but may feel a little delayed for a little longer. We are monitoring and will update again when the issue is fully resolved. Thank you for your patience!

We are aware that you cannot add repositories on Cloud and we are on it! We are sorry for the inconvenience and will update when functionality is restored. If you have any questions, please email support@sourcegraph.com.
This issue is now resolved. Again, we are sorry for any inconvenience this caused. If you have any questions, please email support@sourcegraph.com.

We have identified the issue and it looks to be self-correcting -- if you noticed search improving over the last ~45 minutes, that is correct. We are monitoring to make sure everything is fully restored and will update again when we consider this resolved. Again, if you have any questions in the meantime, please email support@sourcegraph.com.

We are aware that search is intermittently slow on Sourcegraph.com right now. We are on it! We will let you know when this is resolved or if we have any updates to share in the meantime. We are sorry for the inconvenience. If you have any questions, please email support@sourcegraph.com.

incidents.name: Search not working correctly on Sourcegraph Cloud SaaS

incident_updates.body: We have resolved the issue and search is working properly for all users. Again, we are sorry for the inconvenience this issue may have caused. If you have any questions, please email support@sourcegraph.com.

Search has not been working correctly for some of our Sourcegraph Cloud SaaS users for the last ~3 days. You are impacted if you have more than one indexed branch of repositories. We are so sorry for the inconvenience. We are working on a fix now and will update when the fix is in place. If you any questions in the meantime, please email support@sourcegraph.com.

incidents.name: Some repos unavailable on Sourcegraph Cloud SaaS

incident_updates.body: We have resolved the issue and all repositories are available again. We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced during the ~1 hour when some were unavailable. If you have any questions, please email support@sourcegraph.com.

We are seeing an issue on Sourcegraph Cloud SaaS making some repositories unavailable (about 10%). We are working on resolution now and will post when this is fully resolved. If you have any questions, please email support@sourcegraph.com.

incidents.name: Repositories not syncing for organizations on sourcegraph.com

incident_updates.body: We have resolved the issue and will conduct a postmortem to see how we can learn and grow. If you would like to know more, please email support@sourcegraph.com.
We made a modification that has helped. We seem to have ~0 backlog and repositories are now syncing under 1 minute.

We are aware there is an issue with repositories syncing for organizations on sourcegraph.com (aka our Cloud offering). Our self-hosted and managed instance customers are not impacted. We are investigating a resolution. If you have any questions, email support@sourcegraph.com.
We have fully resolved this issue and along the way improved some of our internal process to catch such things faster in the future. If you have any questions, email us at support@sourcegraph.com.

We have addressed the immediate issue and docs.sourcegraph.com is available again. We are now working on fully resolving this issue and will share an update when that is done. We don't expect any more disruptions, but if you notice any, just know we are on it!

We've spotted that something has gone wrong with docs.sourcegraph.com. We're currently investigating the issue, and will provide an update soon. Sorry for any inconvenience this causes. If you have any questions, please email support@sourcegraph.com.

incidents.name: Mis-sequenced migration steps when upgrading to 3.35.0

incident_updates.body: 3.35.1 is now available. When upgrading to 3.35 from any previous version of Sourcegraph, please upgrade to 3.35.1. If you have already upgraded to 3.35.0, please upgrade to 3.35.1. Again, upgrading is the only reliable way to resolve this issue. If you have any questions, email support@sourcegraph.com.

We are so close to having 3.35.1 available, but we need a little more time to complete our testing and make sure the patch properly resolves the issue. We should have this ready within another 24 hours from this post (likely much sooner). Unfortunately, upgrading will be the only reliable remediation. We are sorry we cannot offer an alternative remediation option (like the manual steps we mentioned in our last post). As always, if you have any questions, email support@sourcegraph.com.

We are still working on a patch for 3.35.1, as well as steps for anyone who has already upgraded to 3.35.0 to take in lieu of upgrading to 3.35.1 (we now anticipate having both ready within 24 hours from this post). Again, if you have not yet upgraded to 3.35, please wait until 3.35.1 is available. We will post again when 3.35.1 and the manual steps to correct migration mis-sequence are ready. If you have any questions in the meantime, email support@sourcegraph.com.

We are aware there is an issue with our 3.35.0 release (for self-hosted customers) where the migration sequence runs out of sequence and causes existing Code Insights to “disappear” (there is a way to restore them). This issue may impact other parts of the product and we are working to verify that. You are impacted if you have upgraded to 3.35.0 from an earlier version of Sourcegraph, otherwise you are not impacted. We are working on a patch for 3.35.1 and recommend you hold-off upgrading to 3.35 until 3.35.1 is available (we anticipate 3.35.1 will be available within 24-48 hours). We are also investigating the remediation steps for any customers who have upgraded and will share those here and via direct email to those customers. If you have any questions, email support@sourcegraph.com.

incidents.name: Missing repo search bug in Sourcegraph version 3.34 and 3.34.1

incident_updates.body:
We have identified a bug in our 3.34 and 3.34.1 release that can cause some repositories from older Sourcegraph versions to have an unexpected NULL value in one of their columns in the database. We are sorry for the inconvenience and confusion this bug may have caused. If you have already upgraded to 3.34 or 3.34.1, you can either upgrade to 3.34.2 or manually fix this by running the following SQL commands in your Postgres instance (see documentation if you need help connecting to it).

Please run the following SQL statements one-at-a-time. They have been designed to minimize the impact on your Sourcegraph instance while they execute.

  1. Declare a procedure which, when invoked, will incrementally update any repository that has a NULL entry in its stars column to 0 instead:

    CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE set_repo_stars_null_to_zero() AS
$BODY$
DECLARE
  done boolean;
  total integer = 0;
  updated integer = 0;

BEGIN
  SELECT COUNT(*) INTO total FROM repo WHERE stars IS NULL;

  RAISE NOTICE 'repo_stars_null_to_zero: updating % rows', total;

  done := total = 0;

  WHILE NOT done LOOP
    UPDATE repo SET stars = 0
    FROM (
      SELECT id FROM repo
      WHERE stars IS NULL
      LIMIT 10000
      FOR UPDATE SKIP LOCKED
    ) s
    WHERE repo.id = s.id;

    COMMIT;

    SELECT COUNT(*) = 0 INTO done FROM repo WHERE stars IS NULL LIMIT 1;

    updated := updated + 10000;

    RAISE NOTICE 'repo_stars_null_to_zero: updated % of % rows', updated, total;
  END LOOP;
END
$BODY$
LANGUAGE plpgsql;

  2. Call the procedure that was declared in the previous step:

    CALL set_repo_stars_null_to_zero();

  3. Change the repo table to make the stars column not nullable:

    ALTER TABLE repo
  ALTER COLUMN stars SET NOT NULL,
  ALTER COLUMN stars SET DEFAULT 0;
If you have not yet upgraded to 3.34, please be sure to upgrade to 3.34.2 when you do. If you have any questions, please email support@sourcegraph.com.

incidents.name: Deleted saved searches and email notifications

incident_updates.body: We have restored saved searches. Again, we are sorry for the inconvenience this may have caused and if you have any questions, please email support@sourcegraph.com.

As part of resolving a bug, we accidently deleted all saved searches that belonged to some organizations. If you are affected by this, you would have noticed that your saved searches are gone and we triggered a bunch of emails (~15) about your saved searches. 

We are very sorry for the inconvenience and confusion.

We are working to restore saved searches now and will update here when that is done. We anticipate this will be done by the end of this week.

As we restore saved searches, we are also working to compile a list of impacted users so we can follow-up with them directly to apologize and inform them of the details.

If you have any questions, please email support@sourcegrah.com.
The issue was identified and resolved. A postmortem is underway, and we'll share updates when that process is completed.
We are back online, and are investigating the root cause.
